title: Scoop Shops
name: Scoop Shops
description:
A Map by Baostar

Add your favorite ice cream shops!

properties.name: Al Gelato
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie806 S. Robertson Blvd., Los Angeles, CAAt the upscale end of Robertson sits a quaint Italian ice-cream parlor where a friendly waitstaff helps you indulge your sweet tooth and savory cravings.

properties.name: Angelato Café
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 301 Arizona Ave., Santa Monica, CA 90401Angelato Café specializes in gelato, sorbetto, tofulati, yogurt, sugar-free products, novelty items, panini sandwiches and espresso, latte, cappuccino, soup and salad. With over 100 flavors of gelato, there\'s something for everyone to enjoy!

properties.name: Big J's Frozen Custard
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2094 North Tustin St, Orange, CA714-921-2932 What kind of ice cream establishment can exist and thrive on only four flavors? Big J\'s can. To go with the quartet of flavors offered (chocolate, vanilla, and two flavors that change on a weekly basis), Big J\'s offers loads of choices for toppings and how you want your custard served, from milkshakes to their "Hurricanes," a blended mix of custard and toppings. We had the privilege of eating both peanut butter and almond praline frozen custards, the two featured flavors of the week. While the peanut butter flavor wasn\'t as strong as it could have been, the thick and almost chewy texture of the custard was still pleasant. The almond praline was the first of the four flavors we completely devoured, a testament to its delightfulness.

properties.name: Bilboquet
properties.description: Posted by Fritz 1311 rue Bernard oeust, Montreal, CanadaThe most delicious ice cream in Montreal. They have a nice outdoor patio in front.

properties.name: Bombay Ice Creamery
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  552 Valencia St, San Francisco, CA Ice-cream parlor, Indian boutique, sari shop. Buy a do-it-yourself henna tattoo kit!

properties.name: Capriccio Gelato Caffe
properties.description: Posted by Baobot951 Starbuck St Apt B, Fullerton, CACapriccio\'s gelato is so creamy and smooth, it\'s hard to believe it contains 7 percent fat, less than the 10 percent that ice cream has. First-time business owner Lailah Pae rises at 5 a.m. every day to churn out the gelato and sorbettos from scratch, so you know it\'s all fresh and good. Pae used to work as an administrator at a construction company, but a backpacking trip in Europe where she tasted gelato for the first time convinced her that she was meant for sweeter things in life. Opened Oct. 15, 2005. (Jit Fong Chin)

properties.name: Carol's Custard
properties.description: Posted by Dougherj  Small summer only custard stand on Route 83 that connects Rt 47 (the legendary Delsea Drive) with Rt 9. Common path to Avalon.

properties.name: Chantilly
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 202 Park Ave, Laguna Beach, CAThis place has been a fixture in Laguna Beach for ages, and rightly so. It seems there\'s always a stream of people coming in and out of the store, a line forming all the way to the corner of the intersection where Chantilly sits. These people don\'t seem to mind that they\'re not at the Haagen-Dazs store just around the corner. What we loved above all at Chantilly were the cotton candy and strawberry cheesecake flavors. The cotton candy is a fun, almost bubble gum flavor with bright, colorful bursts of candy. We were giddy as children while we were eating this. The strawberry cheesecake ice cream offers a very subdued cheesecake flavor, one that becomes more evident as the ice cream melts on your tongue. It\'s light enough to have at least two scoops without getting sick of it, its wispiness contrasted by a strong strawberry flavor that complements its perfectly. These flavors at Chantilly alone are worth the painstaking effort of trying to find parking in the nearby congested streets.

properties.name: Delicias de Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  13466 Harbor Blvd, Garden Grove, CA714-636-7163 While we\'re used to ice cream flavors like the standard vanilla and chocolate, it\'s at Delicias de Mexico in Garden Grove where the brave can really venture out and try a surprising array of flavors, from a scoop made from the tropical Mamay fruit, to a corn flavored "paleta de leche," or ice cream bar. A standout in this store is the Chongos ice cream, which is like tried and true vanilla ice cream with a twist: There\'s a hint of cinnamon in each spoonful, along with tiny, chewy flecks of sweet curded milk candy. On this hot day, the Chongos ice cream didn\'t even have time to melt before we wolfed it down. And while this place has by far some of the most creative ice cream flavors, it does right by us in the standard flavors as well. Cookies and cream is a tasty surprise, with a sweet, soft vanilla flavor countered by crunchy, almost salty chocolate cookies. Out of all the scoops of cookies and cream we ate, Delicias de Mexico\'s was the favorite.

properties.name: Dippin' Dots
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   5101 Charter 18011 Newhope Street, Suite D, Fountain Valley, CAYou can get a whopping 30 servings tub of Delicious Dippin\' Dots for party with flavors like banana split, cotton candy, mint chocolate, and peanut butter chip.

properties.name: Gelato Amore
properties.description: Posted by System4187 Campus Dr, Irvine, CAGelato Amore (949) 872-2488

properties.name: Gelato Classico
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 2756 E Pacific Coast Hwy, Corona Del Mar, CAA dense, decadent treat that has less fat than ice cream? It sounds almost too good to be true. But thank heavens, it\'s not. At Gelato Classico in Corona Del Mar, flavors are rich and vibrant. The difference between gelato and ice cream is that gelato is made with milk, ice cream is made with cream. Ice cream also has air added into it to achieve it\'s consistency, while gelato has no air added at all, making it more dense. Here, one of the flavors to try is Coppa Mista, a blend of vanilla, chocolate, hazelnut and pistachio. Each flavor is impressive enough to stand alone, but when layered together, the final product has amazing depth. Also worth trying are a sinful burgundy cherry that made us feel regal when eating it, and the raspberry sorbetto, almost as romantic as the Italian language itself.

properties.name: Gelato Paridiso Authentic
properties.description: Posted by System401 Newport Center Dr, Newport Beach, CAGelato Paridiso Authentic (949) 718-9800

properties.name: Hans' Homemade Ice Cream
properties.description: Posted by System 3640 S Bristol St, Santa Ana, CAHans\' Homemade Ice Cream (714) 979-8815

properties.name: Joe's Italian Ice
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 12302 Harbor Blvd, Garden Grove, CAFor years, Philadelphia residents have flocked to Joe\'s Italian Ice in midst of summer heat waves, and in 2002, a Joe\'s opened in Garden Grove at a place that looks like it used to be a taco stand. The red, white and green exterior is definitely an homage to Italy, but under this festive roof is where the real heart of the shop is. Flavors of Italian ice are made with real fruit juice, and there are dozens of them, from Apple Cider to Wild Cherry. The sour watermelon is a bright cherry red, its intense color almost matching its flavor. This flavor packs a punch, making your face involuntarily pucker and leaving your tongue almost a bright a red as the ice itself. Other standouts were a cantaloupe Italian ice, like eating a frozen version of the mellow fruit. The mango flavor is every bit as refreshing as its fruit as well. Italian ice\'s here are served in wax paper cups, and the small size can probably satiate most people. There\'s limited seating outside of the building, so be sure you have somewhere to eat your ices, unless you\'re OK with standing in a parking lot or sitting in your car.

properties.name: La Casa Gelato
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1033 Venables St, Vancouver, BCrotating 208 flavors of gelato (out of more than 500). The favorites? \'\'People really like Ferrero Rocher, chocolate fudge brownie, lemon,\'\' a server behind the counter told me on a recent visit. What don\'t they like? \'\'Well, they try flavors like durian and garlic. But they don\'t buy them.\'

properties.name: Manhattan Beach Creamery
properties.description: Posted by Sleepyfroggie   1120 Manhattan Avenue, Manhattan Beach, CAWelcome to Manhattan Beach Creamery. We are an old-fashioned ice cream parlor, nestled by the beach in southern California, making and serving super premium ice cream, homemade on the premises. Our goal is to make having an ice cream a fun experience for all your family in our Cape Cod style store. We also cater children\'s parties on the premises - please check our parties page to learn how we can make your child\'s party an unforgettable experience. The creamery also supports a full production facility. We can develop, produce and distribute a complete line of super premium ice cream to your specifications.

properties.name: Mio Gelato
properties.description: Posted by Happyto 25 Nw 11th Ave, Portland, ORMio Gelato

properties.name: Mitchell's Ice Cream
properties.description: Posted by Jimyoung 688 San Jose Avenue, San Francisco, CA, 94110Mitchell\'s Ice Cream 415-648-2300

properties.name: Scoops Gelato / Antai Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Hundredflowers  712 N. Heliotrope Drive Los Angeles, CA Gelato from heaven. The owner of this gelato boutique makes each gourmet batch by hand. Here you\'ll find mind blowing flavors like white-chocolate-wasabi rubbing elbows with old and delicious standbys like pistachio. You must go here!

properties.name: Summer nights in NY require ice cream
properties.description: Posted by Jason Grab a cone and watch the sun set over Manhattan

properties.name: fosselman's ice cream co
properties.description: Posted by Dvd1824 W. Main St, Alhambra, CAold fashioned ice cream that\'s 16% butterfat...yum. try the spumoni.
